info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Gaston and northeastern York Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 925 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Gastonia, or near Cramerton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Gastonia, Central Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Belmont, Cramerton, Lowell, Ranlo, Mcadenville and Charlotte Douglas Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
